intro: Primulina fangdingii, commonly known as the Fangding arrowroot, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit with thick, fleshy stems that store water, adapting to its humid, subtropical habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
